intro: Triantha glutinosa, commonly known as sticky triantha, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a reddish or purplish tinge. Triantha glutinosa is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
